dialogueTree.title: Interfacing: "The chain trails off into the ocean..."
dialogueTree.english: The chain trails off into the ocean, connecting the island to the supply depot on the coast.
dialogueTree.polish: Łańcuch niknie pod powierzchnią oceanu. Łączy wyspę ze składem zaopatrzeniowym na brzegu.
dialogueTree.belarusian: Ланцуг знікае пад паверхняй акіяна. Ён злучае востраў са складам забеспячэння на беразе.

links.title: You: "What for?"
links.english: What for?
links.polish: Po co?
links.belarusian: Навошта?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant looks at the mechani..."
links.english: The lieutenant looks at the mechanism overhead. "Ah, yes... so it seems."
links.polish: Porucznik spogląda na umieszczony wysoko mechanizm. „Ach, tak. Na to wygląda”.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант глядзіць на размешчаны высока механізм. «Ах, так. Падобна, што так».

links.title: Cuno: "The boy stares at the mechanism. "C..."
links.english: The boy stares at the mechanism. "Cool fucking chain."
links.polish: Chłopak wpatruje się w mechanizm. „Kurewsko zajebisty łańcuch”.
links.belarusian: Хлопец углядаецца ў механізм. «Чортава клёвая ланцужнік».

links.title: Interfacing: "For bringing supplies: munitions an..."
links.english: For bringing supplies: munitions and fuel. You could also raise it, in order to lock the Western bay of Revachol.
links.polish: Żeby można było sprowadzać tu zapasy. Amunicję i paliwo. Można też go podnieść i zamknąć zachodnią część Zatoki Revacholskiej.
links.belarusian: Каб можна было пастаўляць сюды запасы. Боепрыпасы і паліва. Таксама можна падняць яго і зачыніць заходнюю частку заліва Рэвшольскага.

links.title: You: ""What do you think it was used for?""
links.english: "What do you think it was used for?"
links.polish: „Jak myślisz, do czego był używany?”
links.belarusian: «Як ты думаеш, для чаго гэта выкарыстоўвалі?»

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""For bringing munitions to the isla..."
links.english: "For bringing munitions to the island, maybe? And supplies. You could also *lock* the bay, when you raise the chain."
links.polish: „Może do transportu na wyspę amunicji? I zapasów. Można też *zamknąć* zatokę poprzez uniesienie łańcucha”.
links.belarusian: «Можа, для транспарта патронаў на выспу? І запасаў. Можна таксама *закрыць* затоку шляхам узняцця ланцуга».

links.title: Visual Calculus: "As a defensive measure locking off..."
links.english: As a defensive measure locking off that side of the bay.
links.polish: Jako środek obronny chroniący tę część akwenu.
links.belarusian: Як сродак абароны, які ахоўвае гэтую частку вадаёма.

links.title: Cuno: ""Fuck does Cuno know?" He shrugs hi..."
links.english: "Fuck does Cuno know?" He shrugs his shoulders. "Cuno would use it to bring shit to the island."
links.polish: „A skąd ma to Cuno wiedzieć, kurwa?” – wzrusza ramionami. „Cuno by po nim ściągał na wyspę różne gówno”.
links.belarusian: «Адкуль гэта Куна ведаць, бля?» — паціскае плячыма. «Куна б цягнуў на востраў усялякае лайно».

links.title: You: "Lock it from whom?"
links.english: Lock it from whom?
links.polish: Zamknąć przed kim?
links.belarusian: Закрыць перад кім?

links.title: Interfacing: "Enemies."
links.english: Enemies.
links.polish: Przed wrogiem.
links.belarusian: Перад ворагам.

links.title: You: ""Lock it from whom?""
links.english: "Lock it from whom?"
links.polish: „Zamknąć przed kim?”
links.belarusian: "Зачыніць перад кім?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""From enemies." He looks up ahead...."
links.english: "From enemies." He looks up ahead. "Enemies of the Commune of Revachol. This seafort was a revolutionary fortification, I believe..."
links.polish: „Przed wrogiem” – spogląda przed siebie. „Wrogiem Komuny Revacholskiej. Ten fort morski był, zdaje się, fortyfikacją rewolucjonistów...”
links.belarusian: «Перад ворагам» – глядзіць наперад. «Ворагам Камуны Рэвашольскай. Гэты марскі форт быў, здаецца, умацаваннем рэвалюцыянераў...»

links.title: You: "What kind of enemies?"
links.english: What kind of enemies?
links.polish: Jakim wrogiem?
links.belarusian: Якім ворагам?

links.title: Interfacing: "Enemies of the Commune of Revachol."
links.english: Enemies of the Commune of Revachol.
links.polish: Wrogiem Komuny Revacholskiej.
links.belarusian: Ворагам Камуны Рэвашаля.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Of the future. Enemies of mankind."
links.english: Of the future. Enemies of mankind.
links.polish: Przyszłości. Wrogiem ludzkości.
links.belarusian: Будучыня. Вораг чалавецтва.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Enemies of madness. Lunacy. Of the..."
links.english: Enemies of madness. Lunacy. Of the apocalypse taking place here.
links.polish: Wrogiem szaleństwa. Obłędu. Apokalipsy, jaka się tu odbywa.
links.belarusian: Ворагам вар'яцтва. Шаленства. Апакаліпсісу, які тут адбываецца.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Do not be too eager to greet these..."
links.english: Do not be too eager to greet these enemies, black hearted cavalier -- they were also the enemies of Revachol.
links.polish: Nie bądź zbyt skory, aby witać tego wroga, kawalerze o mrocznym sercu. Był to bowiem również wróg Revacholu.
links.belarusian: Не будзь занадта гатовы вітаць гэтага ворага, рыцары з цёмным сэрцам. Бо гэта быў таксама вораг Рэвэхолу.

links.title: You: ""This means I *sorta* got into the..."
links.english: "This means I *sorta* got into the depot door."
links.polish: „To by znaczyło, że *w pewnym sensie* przedostałem się przez drzwi magazynu”.
links.belarusian: «Гэта азначала б, што *ў пэўным сэнсе* я прабраўся праз дзверы склада».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Technically -- no. It doesn't.""
links.english: "Technically -- no. It doesn't."
links.polish: „W gruncie rzeczy to nie. Nie znaczyłoby”.
links.belarusian: «На самай справе гэта не. Не азначала б».

links.title: Interfacing: "He's right."
links.english: He's right.
links.polish: Ma rację.
links.belarusian: Ён мае рацыю.

links.title: Cuno: ""Dunno, pig, doesn't look like we b..."
links.english: "Dunno, pig, doesn't look like we behind a door right now -- just Cuno's 2 cents of course."
links.polish: „No nie wiem, świnio, nie wygląda to, jakbyśmy byli za drzwiami. Takie tam moje trzy reále”.
links.belarusian: «Ну, не ведаю, свіння, не выглядае гэта, як быццам мы былі за дзвярыма. Такія там мае тры рэалы».

links.title: You: "This means I *sorta* got into the d..."
links.english: This means I *sorta* got into the depot door.
links.polish: To by znaczyło, że *w pewnym sensie* przedostałem się przez drzwi magazynu.
links.belarusian: Гэта азначала б, што *ў пэўным сэнсе* я прайшоў праз дзверы складоўні.

links.title: Interfacing: "Technically -- no. Sorry."
links.english: Technically -- no. Sorry.
links.polish: W gruncie rzeczy to nie. Przykro mi.
links.belarusian: На самой справе, не. Прабачце.

links.title: You: "[Finish thought.]"
links.english: [Finish thought.]
links.polish: [Zakończ myśl].
links.belarusian: [Скончы думку].
